Armored Kilt.Description: The armored kilt is made of a thick cloth skirt with bars of steel hanging down from the waist and a ring of horizontal steel plates just above the hem.
Armored Kilt.Special: An armored kilt can be worn with other armor, and turns light armor into medium armor, and medium armor into heavy armor.

Dancing Scarves.Description: This set of colorful scarves is made of heavy silk and reinforced with leather straps.
Dancing Scarves.Special: You only get their AC bonus if you move at least 10 feet during your turn, this lasts until your next turn.

Haramaki.Description: Also called a belly-warmer, a haramaki is a simple silken sash lined with chainmail or articulated metal plates and tied about the stomach to protect it.

Padded.Description: More than simple clothing, padded armor combines heavy, quilted cloth and layers of densely packed stuffing to create a cheap and basic protection.

Quilted Cloth.Description: This enhanced form of padded armor has internal layers specifically designed to trap arrows, bolts, darts, shuriken, thrown daggers, and other small ranged piercing weapons.
Quilted Cloth.Special: Wearing quilted cloth armor gives you DR 3/— against small ranged weapon attacks.

Reinforced Tunic.Description: Sometimes called a leine, this belted tunic has thick cords woven through it that cover vital areas.
Reinforced Tunic.Special: You get a +2 to AC versus confirming critical hits.

Silken Ceremonial Armor.Description: These robes consist of several layers of cloth and an outer layer of silk intricately woven with gold brocade designs and covered with metal studs.

Lamellar Cuirass.Description: This armor consists of a light breastplate and shoulder guards made from lacquered leather plates bound together and fitted over a silk shirt.

Leather.Description: Leather armor is made up of multiple overlapping pieces of leather, boiled to increase their natural toughness and then deliberately stitched together.

Rosewood Armor.Description: This suit of leather armor is wrapped in special rose vines, granting it armor spikes. You must water the vines with a gallon of water each day to maintain the spikes.

Hell Knight Leather.Description: This studded leather armor includes heavy gloves and a helm of sculpted leather designed to look like a skull-either a human’s or that of some aquatic creature.

Hide Shirt.Description: Made from animal hide and giant lizard scales over a shirt of interwoven cords, these chest and shoulder coverings protect without restricting mobility.
Hide Shirt.Special: You may attempt a DC 15 Strength check as a standard action. If it succeeds, the armor gains the broken condition and drops to the ground rather than requiring the usual 1 minute to remove.

Leaf Armor.Description: Alchemically treated leaves have been sticthed together to make jerkins, bracers, and leggings.

Parade Armor.Description: A showy noncombat uniform that still grants a small ammount of protection.
Parade Armor.Special: Wearing a country’s parade armor, grants a +2 circumstance bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate checks to influence a person from that country.

Spider-Silk Bodysuit.Description: This exotic form-fitting garment is woven entirely from alchemically treated silk harvested from giant spiders or other arachnid creatures.
Spider-Silk Bodysuit.Special: If you have the drow’s weapon familiarity racial trait, you treat the spider-silk bodysuit’s maximum Dexterity bonus as 2 higher.

Studded Leather.Description: An improved form of leather armor, studded leather armor is covered with dozens of metal protuberances.

Wooden.Description: This suit of leather armor has plates of fire-treated wood sewn over vital areas.
Wooden.Special: Wooden armor is slightly bouyant and the armor check penalty for swimming in this armor is 0.

Chain Shirt.Description: Covering the torso, this shirt is made up of thousands of interlocking metal rings.

Lamellar (Leather).Description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Armored Coat.Description: This sturdy leather coat is reinforced with metal plates sewn into the lining.
Armored Coat.Special: You may don or remove the coat as a move action.

Chain Coat.Description: This relatively simple armor consists of heavy chains that wrap around your body and limbs.
Chain Coat.Special: You may affix a spiked chain to each hand, to use as weapons which cannot be disarmed.

Hide.Description: Hide armor is made from the tanned skin of particularly thick-hided beasts, stitched with either multiple overlapping layers of crude leather or exterior pieces of leather stuffed with padding or fur.

Ice Coat.Description: Used by natives to the arctic tundra, this heavy parka is treated as an armored coat.
Ice Coat.Special: It provides the benefits of a cold-weather outfit, grants a +2 circumstance bonus to stealth in snow, and it can be donned or removed as a move action.

Do-Maru.Description: It consists primarily of lamellar and lacks a solid breastplate or sleeves, leaving the shoulders and upper body somewhat exposed, but permitting the wearer greater flexibility than do the majority of heavier armors.

Kikko Armor.Description: Kikko armor consists of a clever arrangement of hexagonal plates made from iron and sewn to cloth, granting the wearer greater  flexibility than that provided by many armors that afford similar defense.

Lamellar (Horn).Description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Scale Mail.Description: Scale mail is made up of dozens of small, overlapping metal plates and includes a pair of gauntlets.

Breastplate.Description: A breastplate protects a wearer’s torso with a single piece of sculpted metal, similar to the core piece of a suit of full plate.

Agile Breastplate.Description: This breastplate is specially crafted in a manner that allows extra maneuverability in some physical activities.
Agile Breastplate.Special: The armor check penalty for Climb and Acrobatics checks made to jump is only –1.

Chainmail.Description: Chainmail protects the wearer with a complete mesh of chain links that cover the torso and arms, and extends below the waist. The suit includes gauntlets.

Four-Mirror Armor.Description: This armor consists of four plates harnessed together with leather shoulder straps, and comes with a spiked helmet with a chainmail hood.

Lamellar (Steel).Description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Mountain Pattern Armor.Description: This medium armor consists of hundreds of small, interlocking pieces of steel shaped to resemble an ancient symbol for the word mountain.

Banded Mail.Description: Banded mail is made up of overlapping strips of metal, fastened to a sturdy backing of leather and chain.

Field Plate.Description: This heavy armor is similar to full plate but lighter in construction, sacrificing a bit of protection for greater flexibility and mobility.

Kusari Gusoku.Description: This armor has a chain jacket, arm, shoulder, and thigh guards, and either an armored hood or kabuto helmet.

Lamellar (Iron).Description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Splint Mail.Description: Splint mail is made up of overlapping layers of metal strips attached to a backing of leather or sturdy fabric, and includes gauntlets.

Tatami-Do.Description: Tatami-do is a full-body field armor that combines both metal lamellar and kikko components into a suit of mail with a cloth backing.

Fortress Plate.Description: Fortress plate is incredibly bulky, featuring layers of overlapping plates.
Fortress Plate.Special: Fortress plate is incredibly bulky and cannot have it's armor category reduced (even by mithral).

Half-Plate.Description: Half-plate armor combines elements of full plate and chainmail, incorporating several sizable plates of sculpted metal with an underlying mesh of chain links. Half-plate armor includes gauntlets and a helm.

Agile Half-Plate.Description: This style of half-plate is specially crafted in a manner that allows extra maneuverability for some physical activities.
Agile Half-Plate.Special: The armor check penalty for Climb and Acrobatics checks made to jump is only –1, and you can still run at 4x speed.

Hell Knight Half-Plate.Description: The armor worn by a Hell Knight signifer is a vestment of armored plates, chain, and dark fabric. It includes a signifier mask and can be donned and removed as medium armor.

Lamellar (Stone Coat).Description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

O-Yoroi.Description: Worn almost exclusively by highranking samurai, o-yoroi—or “great armor”—is a heavy combat armor that consists of various supplementary components that include both plate and lamellar elements.

Full Plate.Description: A complete suit of full plate (or platemail, as it is often called) includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and a thick layer of padding that is worn underneath the armor. Each suit of full plate must be individually fitted to its owner by a master armorsmith, although a captured suit can be resized to fit a new owner at a cost of 200 to 800 (2d4 x 100) gold pieces.

Gray Maiden Plate.Description: This armor is functionally identical to full plate, but is distinctive to the Gray Maidens.

Hell Knight Plate.Description: A special type of full plate that grants extra effects to Hell Knights.

Stone Plate.Description: This armor is crafted by dwarven stonesmiths from alchemically strengthened plates of basalt and primarily worn by dwarven druids.

Buckler.Description: This small metal shield is worn strapped to your forearm to allow you to still wield a weapon with that hand.
Buckler.Special: While using a weapon in the hand a buckler is strapped to, you take a -1 on attack rolls.

Klar.name: Klar
Klar.Description: A small shield with spikes used for both offense and defense.

Madu (Leather).name: Madu (Leather)
Madu (Leather).Description: This small shield has two antlers, usually from an antelope extending out either side.
Madu (Leather).Special: If you are proficient with the madu, you take only a -2 when fighting defensively instead of the usual -4.

Madu (Steel).name: Madu (Steel)
Madu (Steel).Description: This small shield has two antlers, usually from an antelope extending out either side.
Madu (Steel).Special: If you are proficient with the madu, you take only a -2 when fighting defensively instead of the usual -4.

Light Shield (Steel).name: Light Shield (Steel)
Light Shield (Steel).Description: A simple shield made of good steel.

Light Shield (Steel Quickdraw).name: Light Shield (Steel Quickdraw)
Light Shield (Steel Quickdraw).Description: A simple shield made of good steel and designed for quick retrieval.
Light Shield (Steel Quickdraw).Special: If your BAB is at least +1 you may don or remove this shield as a swift action combined with a move action.

Light Shield (Wooden).name: Light Shield (Wooden)
Light Shield (Wooden).Description: A simple shield made of solid wood.

Light Shield (Wooden Quickdraw).name: Light Shield (Wooden Quickdraw)
Light Shield (Wooden Quickdraw).Description: A simple shield made of solid wood and designed for quick retrieval.
Light Shield (Wooden Quickdraw).Special: If your BAB is at least +1 you may don or remove this shield as a swift action combined with a move action.

Heavy Shield (Steel).name: Heavy Shield (Steel)
Heavy Shield (Steel).Description: A sturdy metal shield reinforced with good steel.

Heavy Shield (Wooden).name: Heavy Shield (Wooden)
Heavy Shield (Wooden).Description: A sturdy wooden shield reinforced with bands of solid hardwood.

Tower Shield.name: Tower Shield
Tower Shield.special: You cannot make a shield bash with a tower shield
Tower Shield.Description: These massive shields can be used to provide cover to nearly the entire body.
Tower Shield.Special: A tower shield is unweildy and applies a -2 to your attack rolls when equiped. As a standard action, you can use the tower shield to grant yourself total cover until the beggining of your next turn. Choose one edge of your space and that edge is treated as a wall for attacks targeting you.

Snarlshield (Steel).name: Snarlshield (Steel)
Snarlshield (Steel).Description: A sturdy metal shield reinforced with good steel and a dozen rods protruding from the surface to grab enemy weapons.

Snarlshield (Wooden).name: Snarlshield (Wooden)
Snarlshield (Wooden).Description: A sturdy wooden shield reinforced with bands of solid hardwood with a dozen protruding rods to grab enemy weapons.

Dwarven War-Shield.name: Dwarven War-Shield
Dwarven War-Shield.Description: The shield's sides are cut into jagged angles, honed to razor sharpness.
Dwarven War-Shield.Special: If you have Two-Weapon Fighting, you increase the higher shield bonus by 1. You lose this bonus for 1 round when you make an attack with one or both shields.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.Description: Just a punch or slap of the hand.
Unarmed Strike.Special: Unarmed strikes are always considered light attacks and can be used with the weapon finesse feat.

Gauntlet.name: Gauntlet
Gauntlet.Description: A metal glove that lets you deal lethal damage with unarmed strikes. Medium and heavy armors (except breastplate) come with gauntlets.

Battle Aspergillum.name: Battle Aspergillum
Battle Aspergillum.Description: Named for the common aspergillum, a mace-like tool used by priests to sprinkle holy water, this light mace has a hollow head and a metal plug to fit the hollow’s neck.
Battle Aspergillum.Special: When the mace hits a creature, holy water sprinkles out; creatures subject to damage from holy water take 1 point of additional damage. You must refill the aspergillum after 5 hits with a standard action that provokes an AoO.

Brass Knife.name: Brass Knife
Brass Knife.Description: Though brass doesn’t hold as sharp an edge as steel, it isn’t vulnerable to rust like steel is.

Brass Knuckles.name: Brass Knuckles
Brass Knuckles.Description: These close combat weapons are designed to fit comfortably around the knuckles, narrowing the contact area and therefore magnifying the amount of force delivered by a punch.
Brass Knuckles.Special: You may hold an object in a hand wearing brass knucles, but you cannot weild a weapon. You may also cast a spell with somantic components with a concentration check (DC 10 + spell level).

Cestus.name: Cestus
Cestus.Description: The cestus is a glove of leather or thick cloth that covers the wielder from mid-finger to mid-forearm, ofen reinforced with metal plates over the fingers.
Cestus.Special: You may wield or carry items while wearing a cestus, howeveer you take a -2 to all precision-based tasks involving that hand (such as opening locks).

Dagger.name: Dagger
Dagger.Description: A dagger has a blade that is about 1 foot in length.
Dagger.Special: You get a +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand skill checks made to conceal a dagger on your body.

Punching Dagger.name: Punching Dagger
Punching Dagger.Description: A punching dagger’s blade is attached to a horizontal handle that projects out from the fist when held.

Spiked Gauntlet.name: Spiked Gauntlet
Spiked Gauntlet.Description: A glove made of metal with jagged spikes for extra damage, and the cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet.
Spiked Gauntlet.Special: An attack with a spiked guantlet is considered an armed attack, and it cannot be disarmed.

Traveling Kettle.name: Traveling Kettle
Traveling Kettle.Description: These small tea kettles are made with clamping lids and heavily reinforced handles.
Traveling Kettle.Special: A traveling kettle with boiling water inside deals an additional 1 point of fire damage on a hit. Boiling water cools to a non-damaging temperature after 5 minutes.

Hook Hand.name: Hook Hand
Hook Hand.Description: Pirates who lose a hand in the course of their adventures sometimes attach hooks to their wrists.

Kunai.name: Kunai
Kunai.Description: Crafted from a single piece of iron, a kunai has a leaf-shaped blade and a ring for a pommel. Adapted from the common trowel, the kunai has a thick blade that is sharpened only near the tip.

Light Mace.name: Light Mace
Light Mace.Description: A light mace is made up of an ornate metal head attached to a simple wooden or metal shaft.

Sickle.name: Sickle
Sickle.Description: A curved blade extends from the basic wooden handle, though usable in a pinch the sickle is mainly a farming tool.

Spring Blade.name: Spring Blade
Spring Blade.Description: This 4-inch blade is attached via a hinge to a wooden handle with a slot in the center, into which the blade can be folded.
Spring Blade.Special: A spring blade is easy to conceal: an observer must succeed at a DC 20 Perception check to notice the blade hidden within the wooden handle, and you gain a +4 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks to conceal a spring blade on your body.

Wodden Stake.name: Wodden Stake
Wodden Stake.Description: This close combat weapon is just a sharpened piece of wood. Iron spikes used as weapons deal damage as wooden stakes.

Club.name: Club
Club.Description: This weapon is usually just a shaped piece of wood, sometimes with a few nails or studs embedded in it.

Mere Club.name: Mere Club
Mere Club.Description: Traditionally made of carved stone, the mere (MEH-reh) is a short, flat-sided, sharp-pointed club.

Heavy Mace.name: Heavy Mace
Heavy Mace.Description: A heavy mace has a larger head and a longer handle than a normal (light) mace.

Morningstar.name: Morningstar
Morningstar.Description: A morningstar is a spiked metal ball, affixed to the top of a long handle.

Shortspear.name: Shortspear
Shortspear.Description: A shortspear is about 3 feet in length, making it a suitable thrown weapon.

Bayonet.name: Bayonet
Bayonet.Description: Bayonets are close combat weapons designed to fit into the grooves or muzzles of crossbows and firearms.

Boarding Pike.name: Boarding Pike
Boarding Pike.Description: A boarding pike is an 8-foot-long pole topped with a foot-long tapered metal tip.

Kumade.name: Kumade
Kumade.Description: Adapted from a garden rake, the kumade consists of a wood or bamboo pole topped with a metal claw. The rake head doubles as a grappling hook.

Collapsible Kumade.name: Collapsible Kumade
Collapsible Kumade.Description: This weapon acts as a kumade, but the handle consists of bamboo sections held together by a taut rope running through the center.

Lantern Staff.name: Lantern Staff
Lantern Staff.Description: This long metal staff has reservoirs for lamp oil, and a lantern-like structure at its head.

Longspear.name: Longspear
Longspear.Description: A longspear is about 8 feet in length.

Quarterstaff.name: Quarterstaff
Quarterstaff.Description: A quarterstaff is a simple piece of wood, about 5 feet in length.

Spear.name: Spear
Spear.Description: A spear is 5 feet in length and can be thrown.

Boar Spear.name: Boar Spear
Boar Spear.Description: This spear with a spiraling blade has a metal crossbar approximately halfway down its length.

Weighted Spear.name: Weighted Spear
Weighted Spear.Description: This pole has a spear head at one end and a mace head at the other. It can be wielded like a standard spear (though it isn’t balanced for throwing), or it can be used as a double weapon, alternately thrusting and bashing.

Blowgun.name: Blowgun
Blowgun.Description: Blowguns are generally used to deliver debilitating (but rarely fatal) poisons from a distance. They are nearly silent when fired.

Heavy Crossbow.name: Heavy Crossbow
Heavy Crossbow.Description: You draw a Heavy Crossbow back by truning a small winch, this takes a full-round action that provkes Attacks of Opportunity

Heavy Crossbow (Underwater).name: Heavy Crossbow (Underwater)
Heavy Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.

Light Crossbow.name: Light Crossbow
Light Crossbow.Description: You draw a Light Crossbow back by pulling a lever, this takes a move action that provokes Attacks of Opportunity.

Light Crossbow (Underwater).name: Light Crossbow (Underwater)
Light Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.

Javelin.name: Javelin
Javelin.Description: A javelin is a thin throwing spear.

Sling.name: Sling
Sling.Description: A sling is little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of strings.

Stingchuck.name: Stingchuck
Stingchuck.Description: A stingchuck is a foul bag made of a humanoid’s head with the brain removed and the skull heavily scored so that it bursts open when thrown.

Stonebow.name: Stonebow
Stonebow.Description: A stonebow, or bullet crossbow, resembles a light crossbow except for the distinct U-shaped bend in the stock.

Throwing Darts.name: Throwing Darts
Throwing Darts.Description: Darts are missile weapons, designed to fly such that a sharp, often weighted point will strike first.

Crossbow Bolts.name: Crossbow Bolts
Crossbow Bolts.Description: These bolts come in a case or quiver that holds 10 bolts. You may stab with the bolt as a Light Improvised Weapon (-4 to hit) using the damage given.

Crossbow Bolts, Acid.name: Crossbow Bolts, Acid
Crossbow Bolts, Acid.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with acid.

Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison.name: Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison
Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison.Description: These bolts have a strange tip that delivers the poison, but also affects accuracy. Double the range penalties for this bolt.

Crossbow Bolts, Fire.name: Crossbow Bolts, Fire
Crossbow Bolts, Fire.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with a alchemical fire.

Sling Bullets.name: Sling Bullets
Sling Bullets.Description: These bullets come in a leather pouch that holds 10 bullets.

Sling Bullets, Groaning.name: Sling Bullets, Groaning
Sling Bullets, Groaning.Description: These sling bullets are honeycombed with overlapping perforations that cause them to emit an eerie moan audible within 500 feet of their flight path.

Sling Bullets, Smoke.name: Sling Bullets, Smoke
Sling Bullets, Smoke.Description: Uses a touch attack to release noxious smoke (DC 13 Fort), nauseating target for 2 rounds.

Blowgun Darts.name: Blowgun Darts
Blowgun Darts.Description: These light darts have tiny grooves behind the tips. A character can apply poison to a blowgun dart without risk of poisoning himself.
